lead_paragraph: Under the head of "Secession," a Georgia paper has the following: "A horse, the property of Col. Carew, took fright from some unknown cause, yesterday evening, and, breaking away from the buggy to which he was attached, came down Kings-street at a furious pace. Running against a dray, which was passing at the time, he came in contact with the shaft, which penetrated his side, and almost immediately killed him."
